ygData.subject: (Resend) http status in arc records?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Your not seeing status codes because by default ARCReader doesn t parse http headers making CDX output (Maybe we should add an option?).  To change this

Rob Eger wrote:

> I'm trying to get the http status code out of arc records to record in
> my cdx index, but ARCRecordMetaData.getStatusCode() never returns
> anything other than null.  I can look in the arc files and see the
> status codes in each record, so I know they're there. 
>
> What I'm trying to do is identify pages that redirected by catching
> the appropriate status codes.


Your not seeing status codes because by default ARCReader doesn't parse 
http headers making CDX output (Maybe we should add an option?).  To 
change this behavior make following change in ARCReader (or to an 
ARCReader subclass):

Index: src/java/org/archive/io/arc/ARCReader.java
===================================================================
RCS file: 
/cvsroot/archive-crawler/ArchiveOpenCrawler/src/java/org/archive/io/arc/ARCReader.java,v
retrieving revision 1.47
diff -u -r1.47 ARCReader.java
--- src/java/org/archive/io/arc/ARCReader.java  10 Jun 2005 16:57:30 
-0000  1.47+++ src/java/org/archive/io/arc/ARCReader.java  16 Jun 2005 
19:44:03 -0000
@@ -908,7 +908,7 @@

         try {
             // Parsing http headers is costly and not needed dumping cdx.
-            arc.setParseHttpHeaders(false);
+            arc.setParseHttpHeaders(true);
             for (Iterator ii = arc.iterator(); ii.hasNext();) {
                 ARCRecord r = (ARCRecord) ii.next();
                 if (toFile) {


Yours,
St.Ack
